etymology.description: 买(買) (mǎi, "buy") + 完(完) (wán, "finish") + 了(了) (le, "(particle indicating a completed action or change)") = finished buying.
etymology.interpretation: The word 买完了(買完了) (mǎi wán le) conveys that the action of buying has been completed. The use of 了(了) (le, "(particle indicating a completed action or change)") highlights the completion or change in state, specifically that the process of searching for and purchasing items is finished.

parts.english: (particle indicating a completed action or change)

examples.chinese: 我们已经买完了所有需要的东西(我們已經買完了所有需要的東西)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ men yǐ jīng mǎi wán le suǒ yǐ xū yào de dōng xī.
examples.english: We have finished buying everything we need.

examples.chinese: 他刚刚买完了新车(他剛剛買完了新車)。
examples.pinyin: tā gāng gāng mǎi wán le xīn chē.
examples.english: He just finished buying a new car.

examples.chinese: 我们买完了食材(我們買完了食材)，可以开始做饭(可以開始做飯)。
examples.pinyin: wǒ men mǎi wán le shí cái, kě yǐ kāi shǐ zuò fàn.
examples.english: We finished buying the ingredients, so we can start cooking.
